title-group.article-title: "A Palpable Gift of Time": The Convergence of World Standard Time and Mass Advertising in Henry James's "The Ambassadors"

198 The Museum World of Henry James 1986

Tintner explains, "He named his book The Tragic Muse after what every Englishman at that time considered the greatest portrait by the greatest portrait painter in England of the greatest actress in the history of the English stage: Mrs. Siddons as the Tragic Muse, by Sir Joshua Reynolds. It is not named in the novel, but in 1890 it did not need to be.... The Reynolds picture is never described because it is assumed all readers know it" (84-5)
Tintner
The Tragic Muse 84 Mrs. Siddons as the Tragic Muse 1890

"James has entitled his book in frank imitation of four well-known Titians in the Louvre: The Portrait ofa Young Woman at Her Toilet, two paintings entitled The Portrait of a Man, and The Man with the Glove" (60)
James
The Portrait ofa Young Woman at Her Toilet 60 The Man with the Glove
